Bash(gh issue create --title "Improve test coverage from 87% to 90%+" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Current Coverage: 87.43%
**Target**: 90%+

## Modules Needing Improvement

### High Priority (Below 90%)
- **embeddings.py**: 55% coverage - Missing test coverage for error paths
- **pdf_extractor.py**: 59% coverage (in isolated run) / 90% (full run) - Inconsistent
- **embeddings_cache.py**: 57% (isolated) / 93% (full) - Inconsistent
- **orchestrator.py**: 84% coverage - Missing edge cases
- **vector_store.py**: 87% coverage - Near target

### Medium Priority (At Target)
These modules have good coverage but could use additional edge case testing:
- chunker.py: 96%
- recovery.py: 91%
- monitoring.py: 100% (but failing tests indicate incomplete coverage)

## Action Items
1. Add edge case tests for embeddings error handling
2. Fix test isolation issues causing coverage variance
3. Add orchestrator edge case tests
4. Complete vector store error condition tests

## Related
- Depends on #17 (failing tests) being fixed first
EOF
)" --label "enhancement")

Bash(gh issue create --title "Code cleanup and documentation improvements" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''

### Remove Redundancy
- [ ] Consolidate duplicate error handling patterns across modules
- [ ] Remove unused test fixtures
- [ ] Standardize naming conventions (some use snake_case, others vary)
- [ ] Clean up commented-out code

### Improve Documentation
- [ ] Add API reference documentation for public methods
- [ ] Create usage examples for PDF extractor enhancements
- [ ] Document async testing patterns
- [ ] Add troubleshooting guide for common issues

### Code Quality
- [ ] Add type hints to remaining functions missing them
- [ ] Ensure all public methods have docstrings
- [ ] Improve error messages to include more context
- [ ] Add logging to key decision points

## Files Needing Attention
- `src/pipeline/orchestrator.py` - Add comprehensive docstrings
- `src/pipeline/recovery.py` - Document recovery flow
- `src/database/vector_store.py` - Add usage examples
- Test files - Consolidate common fixtures

## Benefits
- Easier onboarding for new developers
- Reduced maintenance burden
- Better IDE autocomplete support
- Clearer error debugging
EOF
)" --label "documentation")
